summary: This is an email chain from June 18, 2019, discussing legal issues related to the Jeffrey Epstein case. It references a prosecution memo sent to front office staff and includes a link to a WNYC Studios story about how Julie Brown broke open the Epstein story. The email also contains contact information for the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Alec Baldwin
persons.context: Mentioned in the email subject line regarding an unspecified matter, but the email content shifts to discussing legal issues and the Epstein story.

persons.name: Julie Brown
persons.context: Referenced in a linked WNYC Studios story as the journalist who broke open the Jeffrey Epstein story.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case being discussed; the email references a story about how his case was broken open.

events.title: Email discussion of Epstein legal issues
events.description: An email exchange discussing legal issues related to the Jeffrey Epstein case, including reference to a prosecution memo sent to front office staff and a news story about the case.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The email is dated June 18, 2019, and discusses legal issues related to the Jeffrey Epstein case.
It references a prosecution memo that was sent to 'front office folks' regarding the case.
The email includes a link to a WNYC Studios story about how journalist Julie Brown broke open the Jeffrey Epstein story.
Contact information for the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York is included in the email signature.
